abstract: Ms. Sortito was a movie-marketing executive who pushed the limits of product tie-ins, most famously in James Bond movies.
snippet: Ms. Sortito was a movie-marketing executive who pushed the limits of product tie-ins, most famously in James Bond movies.
lead_paragraph: Karen Sortito, a movie-marketing executive who pushed the limits of product tie-ins when she put the world’s most famous Aston Martin driver, James Bond, behind the wheel of a BMW and put him in business with Visa cards, Smirnoff vodka, Heineken beer and even L’Oréal lipstick (“Bond Bordeaux”), died in Manhattan on Monday. She was 49.

headline.main: Karen Sortito, Who Told 007 to Start Drinking Smirnoff, Dies at 49
headline.print_headline: Karen Sortito, 49; Told 007 to Start Drinking Smirnoff
